title: From syllables to lines to imagination
content:
[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

[[tabview]]
[[tab Tubby]]
+++ Tubby

Morphing in what it has consumed
It's still cuter than I assumed
This feline fabric grey plushy
//Am hungry, gimme a munchy!//

Remains are regurgitated
Mostly organic related
It's jaw still ever so stretchy
//Am hungry, gimme a munchy!//

Soul devourer, corpse consumer
For some biscuits, GoI defuser
The good ones, so crisp and crunchy
//Am hungry, gimme a munchy!//

Inspired by: [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-4966 SCP-4966] from [[*user Deadly Bread]]
[[/tab]]

[[collapsible show="Translation" hide="Close translation"]] 
This weird dark creature will claim all
That mentions it's name big or small
Don't speak nor write. Really, do none.
Be aware of two five two one

It'll come to you, in any place
No escape from this sweet embrace
You tried hard, still fail to outrun
Be aware of two five two one

I do hope, that it won't claim prose
It entangles me, holds me close
Oh, no! Please, stop! I'm not yet done!
Be aware of two five two one
[[/collapsible]]
Inspired by: [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-2521 ●●|●●●●●|●●|●] from [[*user LurkD]]
[[/tab]]
[[tab Harbinger]]
+++ Harbinger

In the Kuiper, we found a tear
More than billion gone years dormant
It brings a message we must hear
The most important informant

More than billion gone years dormant
The mission, Harbinger must tell
The most important informant
From beyond the planets it fell

The mission, Harbinger must tell
The galaxy, dark, empty, cold
From beyond the planets it fell
Oh, how sad fates will unfold

The galaxy, dark, empty, cold
Proceed our good signaled tiding
Oh, how sad fates will unfold
Please, send your Harbinger flying

Proceed our good signaled tiding
Send this message spacewards on
Please, send your Harbinger flying
//Masters...// Yes, Harbinger well done

Send this message spacewards on
In the Kuiper, we found a tear
//Masters...// Yes, Harbinger well done
It brings a message we must hear

Inspired by: [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-1281 SCP-1281] from [[*user DrEverettMann]]
[[/tab]]
[[tab Limericks]]
Kind of requested in the sense that Calibri likes them and asked me if I tried it before. I didn't so here are my first limericks.

+++ No One Expects The Spanish Decommission! 

The most beautiful Spanish ship
Gave the economy a dip
Wants some silver, some gold
Reduced to ashes' cold
Decommissioned, a last sea trip

Inspired by: [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-4456 SCP-4456-D] by [[*user Calibold]]
------

+++ The cat went to the well

The curious cat went to the well
Below the bricks in the pit it fell
For eight times no avail
only shortened the tail
The ninth time though, it didn't live to tell

Inspired by: Inspired by: [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-2693 SCP-2693] by [[*user Calibold]]
[[/tab]]
[[tab Ƹ̵̡Ӝ̵̨̄Ʒ]]
[[=]]
+++ Ƹ̵̡Ӝ̵̨̄Ʒ
My friend
In the garden
Doodling on a book page
In a garden party event
You have
Finally found your happiness
Let's talk a bit longer
You beautiful
Insect
[[/=]]
Inspired by: [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-5096 SCP-5096] by [[*user DianaBerry]]
[[/tab]]
[[tab Lotsa pasta]]
+++ //Lotsa pasta//

Oh ma goodness! What a ton of pasta!
Linguini, capellini, and fettuccini
Mamma mia, make it stop. Please, basta!
Tortellini, rigatoni, and rotini

Linguini, capellini, and fettuccini
Now bigoli, gigli, what is mostaccioli?
Tortellini, rigatoni, and rotini
Damn, why is this pasta so goddamn wriggly?

Now bigoli, gigli, what is mostaccioli?
Oh, great the lose spaghetti can now talk
Damn, why is this pasta so goddamn wriggly?
I'd rather Bangkok noodles in some stock

Oh, great the lose spaghetti can now talk
Can't we have permission to boil them all?
I'd rather Bangkok noodles in some stock
Oh, shit! Of course, I made the damn box fall

Can't we have permission to boil them all?
Oh ma goodness! What a ton of pasta!
Oh, shit! Of course, I made the damn box fall
Mamma mia, make it stop. Please, basta!

Inspired by: [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-41d3n73-j SCP-41-D3N73-J] by [[*user trennerdios]]
[[/tab]]
[[tab A researcher's day]]
+++ A researcher’s day

Raindrops wake me, in every fiber of my being.
Except my mind, there I'm still dreaming.
I take a cup of tea, it's too early and too grey.
So somber, so weak, what a horrible day.

I put on my coat, hood over my head.
Damn this rain, I want to go back to bed.
I get in my car and start the tires.
Arrived at last, the caffeine expires.

I turn in my coat for a whiter one.
Must focus, procedure has begun.
Needed here to observe a test.
But I cannot help to feel stressed.

Subject keeps getting stranger.
Don't provoke, D-class in danger.
Containment breached, stupid keter.
Results lost, all in the ether.

Got to control room, with little time bought.
Called for help, anomaly caught.
Explained to highers and senior.
No idea, why it's keener.

It's murderous but in very bad shape.
How the hell did it manage to escape?
It can't leave site, security max degree.
But why do I think it's already free?

Going back home like the rest of the staff.
Can't help but to inner laugh.
Oh my, how they can't see…
That I'm part of this SCP.

Inspired by: A poem I wrote earlier for the wiki in basic AABB. Didn't post it because other things came up. I figured I could put it here instead of forgetting it.
[[/tab]]
[[tab For users]]
+++ ManyMeats
//Meat Meat Meat Meat Meat//
//Meat Meat Meat Meat Meat Meat Meat//
//Meat Meat Meat Meat Meat//

In honor of [[*user ManyMeats]]. How the hell did this come out of IRC? Still, what a great guy.
[[/tab]]
[[/tabview]]
@@ @@
[[collapsible show="Used formats" hide="Close formats"]]
I did not necessarily stay true to these formats, but that also is the beauty of freedom poetry brings.

**Kyrielle:** A French form in quatrains with 8 syllables per line that have AABB rhyme. Each quatrain must end with the same line. Fourth line gets repeated, all 3^^rd^^ and 4^^th^^ lines rhyme.

**Phantoum:** Quatrains where the second and fourth line become the first and the third line in the following quatrain. In the last quatrain the second and fourth line are the first and third of the first quatrain. Every line gets used twice. ABAB rhyme.

**Limerick:** They only have 5 lines but they do count syllables and rhyme (AABBA). The most commonly known limericks are probably nursery rhymes.

**Butterfly:** 9 lines with 2-4-6-8-2-8-6-4-2 syllable count.

**Haiku:** Japanese form, 3 lines, 5-7-5 syllables
[[/collapsible]]
